properties.entry: SELECT LOGIN_ID, PASSWORD, E_NAME, ROLE, DELAY_CNT FROM MEMBERS WHERE LOGIN_ID = ? AND password = ?
SELECT ROLE FROM ADMINS WHERE LOGIN_ID = ? AND password = ?

SELECT m.LOGIN_ID, m.E_NAME, m.ROLE, sys.T_NAME, sys.D_NAME, m.DELAY_CNT FROM MEMBERS m JOIN (SELECT EMP_NO, E_NAME, T_NAME, D_NAME FROM (SELECT TEAM_NO, T_NAME, D_NAME FROM sysone.TEAMS t JOIN sysone.DEPARTMENTS d ON t.DEPT_NO = d.DEPT_NO) td JOIN sysone.EMPLOYEES e ON td.TEAM_NO = e.TEAM_NO) sys ON m.LOGIN_ID = sys.EMP_NO
select emp_no , t_name from sysone.employees e join sysone.teams t on e.team_no = t.team_no where e.emp_no = ?

SELECT me.login_id, me.e_name, NVL(b.book_count, 0) AS book_count, NVL(b.last_month_count, 0) AS last_month_count, NVL(b.current_month_count, 0) AS current_month_count, NVL(b.last_year_count, 0) AS last_year_count FROM ( SELECT m.login_id, e.e_name, e.team_no FROM members m JOIN sysone.employees e ON m.login_id = e.emp_no WHERE e.team_no = ?) me LEFT OUTER JOIN ( SELECT b.login_id, COUNT(*) AS book_count, COUNT(CASE WHEN EXTRACT(MONTH FROM b.loan_date) = EXTRACT(MONTH FROM TRUNC(SYSDATE)) - 1 THEN b.login_id END) AS last_month_count, COUNT(CASE WHEN EXTRACT(MONTH FROM b.loan_date) = EXTRACT(MONTH FROM TRUNC(SYSDATE)) THEN b.login_id END) AS current_month_count, COUNT(CASE WHEN EXTRACT(YEAR FROM b.loan_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM TRUNC(SYSDATE)) - 1 THEN b.login_id END) AS last_year_count FROM book_loan_records b WHERE b.return_date IS NULL GROUP BY b.login_id) b ON me.login_id = b.login_id
SELECT b.b_name,b.author,b.publisher,b.l_status,bln.return_pre_date+1 FROM books b left outer join book_loan_records bln on b.book_id = bln.book_id
SELECT B.BOOK_ID, B.ISBN, B.B_NAME, B.AUTHOR, B.PUBLISHER, B.L_STATUS, (BLN.RETURN_PRE_DATE + 1) AS RETURN_PRE_DATE FROM BOOKS B LEFT OUTER JOIN BOOK_LOAN_RECORDS BLN ON B.BOOK_ID = BLN.BOOK_ID

SELECT B.BOOK_ID, B.ISBN, B.B_NAME, B.AUTHOR, B.PUBLISHER, B.L_STATUS, (BLN.RETURN_PRE_DATE + 1) AS RETURN_PRE_DATE FROM BOOKS B LEFT OUTER JOIN BOOK_LOAN_RECORDS BLN ON B.BOOK_ID = BLN.BOOK_ID WHERE LOWER(B.B_NAME) LIKE LOWER(?) ORDER BY B.BOOK_ID
SELECT b.b_name,b.author,b.publisher,bln.loan_date,bln.return_pre_date FROM books b left outer join book_loan_records bln on b.book_id = bln.book_id where bln.login_id = ?
select * from book_requests; select b.login_id , m.e_name,b.b_name ,b.publisher,b.author from book_requests b join members m on b.login_id = m.login_id
